goals.description: Identification of Causes and Sources of Impairment
goals.objective: Identify causes and sources of impairment in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed.
desiredOutcomes: Identification of impaired water bodies using biological and chemical data
Development of TMDLs for impaired streams

goals.objective: Implement strategies to reduce pollutant loads as required by TMDLs.
goals.targetArea: Hickahala Creek, James-Wolf Creek, Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed
desiredOutcomes: Meet TMDL requirements for organic enrichment, low DO, nutrients, and fecal coliform
Implement in-field nutrient and sediment BMPs
Achieve 50% reduction in fecal coliform in Hickahala Creek and 70% reduction in James Wolf Creek

goals.objective: Implement BMPs to address nutrients, sediment, and pathogen issues.
goals.targetArea: Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed (priority: newly converted pasture areas)
desiredOutcomes: Prioritized implementation of BMPs based on water quality benefit, willing landowners, and TMDL recommendations
Effective monitoring and reporting of BMP effectiveness

bmps.name: Fencing
bmps.description: Install fencing to limit livestock access to streams and reduce pathogen and nutrient inputs.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

bmps.schedule: Prioritized for implementation in pasture areas

bmps.name: Tank/Trough (Watering Facilities)
bmps.description: Install watering facilities for livestock away from streams to reduce stream access.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

bmps.schedule: Prioritized for implementation in pasture areas

bmps.name: Ponds
bmps.description: Construct ponds to manage runoff and sedimentation from grazing areas.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

bmps.schedule: Prioritized for implementation in pasture areas

bmps.name: Streambank and Shoreline Protection
bmps.description: Implement measures to protect streambanks and shorelines from erosion.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

bmps.name: Grade Stabilization Structure
bmps.description: Install structures to stabilize grades and prevent erosion.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

bmps.schedule: To be implemented in erosion-prone areas

bmps.name: Heavy Use Area Protection
bmps.description: Protect high-traffic areas from erosion and nutrient/pollutant runoff.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

bmps.schedule: To be implemented in high-use areas

implementation.description: Develop and execute subgrant agreement specifying roles and milestones.
Coordinate meetings, media, and social media promotion for project activities.
Inform landowners/operators and secure participation for BMP implementation.
Determine priority pollutant areas via GIS and site surveys, install BMPs.
Monitor baseline and post-BMP water quality conditions.
Conduct inspections and collect GPS/photo documentation of BMP installations.

monitoring.indicator: Dissolved Oxygen, pH, Temperature, Conductivity, Total Nitrogen, Total Phosphorus, E. coli
monitoring.method: Routine chemical and biological sampling; M-BISQ index
monitoring.frequency: As scheduled and after BMP installation

thresholds.value: Daily Average of 5.0 mg/L; Instantaneous threshold 4.0 mg/L
30-day geometric mean of 126 per 100 ml; not to exceed 410 per 100 ml more than 10% of the time

outreach.name: Watershed Education and Outreach
outreach.description: Conduct workshops, field days, and community events to educate the public on water quality and BMPs.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tate County Soil and Water Conservation District

outreach.indicators: Number of events, attendance, survey results

events.audience: Soil and Water districts, Extension Service

geographicAreas.name: Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek Watershed
geographicAreas.description: Watershed located in Tate County, Mississippi, with diverse land use including cropland, forest, and pasture/grass.

organizations.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tate County Soil and Water Conservation District
